title: Lion Gate at Mycenae
description: The Lion Gate is the main gate in the Cyclopean walls of the citadel of Mycenae. It takes its name from the sculptural decoration placed in the relieving triangle over the monolithic lintel, which depicts two animals (lions or griffins) in heraldic position on either side of a Minoan-style pillar.

properties.description: Representative point for the Lion Gate at Mycenae derived from Google Earth satellite imagery.
properties.title: Imagery location of the Lion Gate at Mycenae
